intro: Galeopsis glandulosa, commonly known as common hedgenettle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has opposite, ovate to lanceolate leaves with glandular dots. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in whorled clusters, which are borne on slender stems. Its hairy stems and leaves are characteristic features, and it often thrives in disturbed soils along roadsides and in waste areas. Galeopsis glandulosa is also known for its medicinal properties, traditionally used in herbal remedies.
